record_data.record_title: Peoples Natural Gas Company Statement of Operating Condition
record_data.record_plain_text: OPERATING STATEMENT OF PEOPLES NATURAL GAS COMPANY LLC UNDER 18 C.F.R. SECTION 284.224 This Operating Statement describes how Peoples Natural Gas Company LLC, a natural gas distribution company, shall provide interruptible transportation service on a non-discriminatory basis pursuant to Section 284.224 of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission s rules and regulations (18 C.F.R. 284.224). SECTION 1. DEFINITIONS 1.1 "Commission" shall mean the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission. 1.2 "Day" shall mean a period of twenty-four consecutive hours beginning at 9 a.m. Eastern Standard Time (except when Daylight Savings Time is in effect, when it shall mean one hour in advance of Eastern Standard Time) and the date of the Day shall be that of its Beginning. 1.3 "Mcf" shall be defined as one thousand cubic feet of gas. 1.4 "Month" shall constitute a period of time beginning at 9 a.m. on the first day of the calendar month and ending 8:59 a.m. on the first day of the succeeding calendar month. 1.5 "PaPUC" shall mean the Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission or any successor to that agency. 1.6 "Psia" is the abbreviation for pounds per square inch absolute. 1.7 The term "quantity of gas" shall refer to the units of gas expressed in MMBtu, unless otherwise specified. 1.8 "Shipper" shall mean any person or entity receiving service. 1.9 "Tariff" shall mean Transporter s Rules, Regulations, and Rate Schedules on file with and approved by the PaPUC. 1.10 "Transporter" and "Company" shall mean Peoples Natural Gas Company LLC. SECTION 2. INTERRUPTIBLE TRANSPORTATION SERVICE 2.1 Character of Service Transporter shall provide interruptible transportation service on a best efforts basis and subject to curtailment due to firm capacity requirements pursuant to Transporter s Tariff. If gas is received by Transporter on any Day for the account of the Shipper, such gas shall be redelivered by Transporter on the same Day as a nominated delivery subject to Transporter s available capacity. 2.2 Sources of Supply Shippers may nominate gas supplies from the following sources for transportation pursuant to this Operating Statement: (a) upstream pipeline(s) or local distribution companies, (b) local production directly connected to Transporter s system and received at metered points of interconnection, and (c) on-system aggregation pools established pursuant to Transporter s Tariff. 2.3 Measurement All quantities of gas received or delivered at points of interconnection with interstate pipelines will be measured in dekatherms as determined by the pipeline, subject to any rights of Transporter or Shipper pursuant to the pipeline s tariff to dispute such quantities. All gas received at receipt points that are not points of interconnection with interstate pipelines shall be measured by meter in Mcf at no more than 8 ounces above an assumed atmospheric pressure of 14.4 pounds at whatever temperature the gas may be during the period of measurement. If such gas is supplied from a low-pressure distribution system in which the pressure of the gas is regulated not to exceed 8 ounces, the measurement will be at whatever pressure the gas may be during the period of measurement. If such gas is received from a higher-pressure system, measurement will be corrected to a pressure base of 14.73 psia. If measurement is corrected for temperature, measurement will be corrected to 60 F. 2.4 Quality Gas delivered into Transporter s system should be free from oil, water, salt, gum, dust, and other foreign substances that might interfere with the marketability of the gas. Unless otherwise agreed to by Transporter, the gas delivered shall contain not less than 1,000 Btu per cubic foot (as determined by calorimeter test @ 60 degrees Fahrenheit and saturated with water vapor). 2.5 Pressure All deliveries of gas by Shipper and Transporter shall be made at Transporter s prevailing pressure. SECTION 3. NOMINATION AND SCHEDULING Shipper shall submit nominations for the transportation service contemplated in this Operating Statement under the terms and conditions as detailed in the application for service available on Transporter s electronic bulletin board. Nominations by similarly situated shippers for interruptible transportation service shall, subject to confirmation by the upstream and/or downstream transporter(s) and the terms and conditions of this Operating Statement, be scheduled by Transporter on a non-discriminatory basis based on Transporter s available capacity. SECTION 4. WARRANTIES Each Shipper under this Operating Statement warrants for itself, its successors and assigns, that Shipper or the party on whose behalf Shipper is acting will at the time of delivery to Transporter for transportation has good and merchantable title to or good right to deliver and receive all such gas free and clear of all liens, encumbrances and claims whatsoever. Shipper will indemnify Transporter and save it harmless from all suits, actions, regulatory proceedings, debts, damages, costs, losses and expenses (including reasonable attorney fees) arising from or out of adverse claims arising from breach of this warranty (including, without limitation, claims from any royalties, taxes, license fees or charges applicable to such gas or to the delivery thereof to Transporter for transportation under the applicable service). Each Shipper under this Operating Statement warrants for itself, its successors and assigns that all gas delivered to Transporter for transportation shall be eligible for transportation in interstate commerce under applicable rules, regulations or orders of the Commission. Shipper will indemnify Transporter and save it harmless from all suits, actions, damages, costs, losses, expenses (including reasonable attorney fees), and regulatory proceedings arising from breach of this warranty. SECTION 5. FORCE MAJEURE Neither Shipper nor Transporter shall be liable in damages, or in any other remedy, legal or equitable, to the other for any acts, omission, or circumstances occasioned by or in consequence of events of force majeure. Force majeure events are defined as acts of God, strikes, lockouts or other industrial disturbances, acts of the public enemy or terrorists, wars, blockades, insurrections, riots, epidemics, landslides, lightning, earthquakes, fires, storms, tropical storm or hurricane warnings issued by the National Weather Service (to the extent that such warnings result in actions preventing or restricting service to Shipper), washouts, arrest or restraint of rulers and people, civil disturbances, explosions, or breakage or accident to machinery or walls or lines of pipe, line or well freezeups, partial or total failure or unavailability of capacity, inability to obtain or unavoidable delay in obtaining materials, supplies, equipment, permits or labor to perform or comply with any obligations or conditions of an agreement, inability to obtain access to rights-of-way, the binding order of any court or governmental authority which has been resisted in good faith by all reasonable legal means, or any other cause, whether of the kind herein enumerated, or otherwise, and whether caused by parties hereto or some person or concern not a party hereto, not within the control of the party claiming suspension and which by the exercise of due diligence such party is unable to prevent or overcome; provided, however, that under no circumstances shall Shipper s lack of finances, inadequate or uneconomic markets for Shipper s gas, or insufficiency of Shipper s gas supplies constitute an event of Force Majeure; nor shall an event of Force Majeure relieve a party of its obligation to make payment of amounts then due. A party claiming Force Majeure shall not be relieved of liability unless such party shall give notice of the same in writing to the other party as soon as possible after the occurrence relied on. SECTION 6. SERVICE LIMITATION Transporter shall not be required to perform service if any of the facilities necessary to render the requested service do not exist or are not available including periods during which facilities are being maintained or repaired. Transporter shall not be required to construct facilities. SECTION 7. REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS Any and all service transaction under this Operating Statement must be interstate service eligible under, and shall be fully subject to, the applicable requirements of Section 284.224 of the Commission s rules and regulations, as they may be revised from time to time. SECTION 8. BILLING AND PAYMENT 8.1 Billing Each calendar month Transporter shall render a statement of account to the Shipper summarizing the charges due Transporter. 8.2 Payment Shipper shall pay Transporter by wire transfer of federal funds unless Shipper and Transporter mutually agree upon a method of payment other than wire transfer which will result in timely receipt of payment by Transporter. Charges previously billed to Shipper by Transporter, for which payment has not been received by Transporter by the due date, will be assessed a late-payment charge of two percent (2%) per month on the unpaid balance. SECTION 9. MISCELLANEOUS 9.1 This Operating Statement and the respective obligations of the parties thereunder, are subject to valid laws, orders, rules and regulations of duly constituted authorities having jurisdiction. 9.2 No waiver by either Transporter or Shipper of any one or more defaults by the other in the performance of any provisions of this Operating Statement or the executed service agreement shall operate or be construed as a waiver of any future default or defaults, whether of a like or of a different character. 9.3 Unless otherwise specifically provided herein, any notice, request, demand, or communication provided for in this Operating Statement or any other notice that Transporter or Shipper may desire to give to the other, shall be in writing and shall be considered as duly delivered when mailed by registered mail to the Post Office address of Transporter or Shipper, or at such other address as either shall designate for formal written notice. Routine communications by telephone between members of the operating staffs of Transporter and Shipper shall be considered duly delivered without confirmation by mail. 9.4 The captions and headings in this Operating Statement are inserted for convenience of reference only and shall not affect the construction or interpretation of the Operating Statement. 9.5 In no event shall Transporter or Shipper be liable to the other for consequential, indirect, special, punitive or exemplary damages arising out of service provided under this Operating Statement. 9.6 This Operating Statement and any agreement for service pursuant hereto shall be governed by the laws of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania without regard to principles of conflicts of laws. The forum for any litigation shall be in a state or federal court located in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. 9.7 Transporter, in its sole discretion, shall have the right at any time to file with the Commission to amend or modify any and all provisions of this Operating Statement without liability to or consent from any Shipper. 9.8 There is no third party beneficiary of any service agreement, and the provisions of a service agreement do not impart enforceable rights to anyone who is not a party. RATE SUMMARY FOR SECTION 284.224 TRANSPORTATION SERVICE Unless discounted on a nondiscriminatory basis, the rate for transportation service under this Operating Statement is $0.7384 per Mcf. Transporter may on a nondiscriminatory basis also retain from Shipper a quantity of gas for incremental fuel use and gas lost and unaccounted for related to transportation of Shipper s gas, not to exceed 7.8%, the maximum transportation retainage rate contained in Transporter s Tariff.
record_data.filing_title: Peoples Natural Gas Company Modification of Baseline eTariff Filing
